body:
Awesome! I hadn't considered the `||` operator.  I don't have 1.9.3, but ran the following tests:

    require 'benchmark'

    class Array

      def from(position)
        self[position..-1]
      end

      def new_from(position)
        position > length ? [] : self[position..-1]
      end

      def o_O(position)
        self[position, length] || []
      end
  
      def o_o(position)
        self[position..-1] || []
      end

    end

    array = (1..10).to_a
    n = 200_000

    Benchmark.bm(10) do |x|
      x.report("original:") { n.times { array.from(1) } }
      x.report("new:") { n.times { array.new_from(1) } }
      x.report("o_0:") { n.times { array.o_O(1) } }
      x.report("o_o:") { n.times { array.o_o(1) } } 
      x.report("original:") { n.times { array.from(100001) } }
      x.report("new:") { n.times { array.new_from(100001) } }
      x.report("o_0:") { n.times { array.o_O(100001) } }
      x.report("o_o:") { n.times { array.o_o(100001) } }
    end
